info.name: VG Monitoring Administration API
info.description: API collection for VivaGuest Monitoring Administration microservice

request.description: Register a new user with tenantId, name, email, and password (min 6 characters). Unique constraint on (tenantId, email).
Login with email and password. Returns access token that is automatically saved to environment.
Get list of all users with tenant information (without passwords). Requires authentication.
Get all users belonging to a specific tenant. Uses tenantId from environment variable. Requires authentication.
Get a specific user by ID. Uses userId from environment variable (set after login). Requires authentication.
Logout and invalidate the current session token. Uses accessToken from environment variable.
Delete a user by ID. Uses userId from environment variable. Requires authentication. Note: Superadmin users (users belonging to SUPER_TENANT) cannot be deleted and will return a 403 Forbidden error.

request.description: Create a new tenant with name, unique slug, admin email, and admin name. Optional fields: phone, address, gateway_type ('MS Teams' or 'Slack'), reservation_import_enabled (default: false), guest_feedback_enabled (default: false), ai_enabled (default: false). For NORMAL tenants, this automatically creates: 1) Two default groups ('admin', 'user'), 2) An admin user with the provided email, name and password 'password123', 3) Assigns the admin user to the 'admin' group. SUPER_TENANT cannot be deleted, and superadmin users cannot be deleted. System groups (super_admin, admin, user) cannot be deleted.
Get list of all tenants (ordered by created_at DESC)
Get a specific tenant by ID. Uses tenantId from environment variable.

request.description: Update tenant name and/or slug. Uses tenantId from environment variable.
Change tenant status to 'active' or 'on hold'. Uses tenantId from environment variable.
Delete a tenant by ID. Uses tenantId from environment variable. Note: SUPER_TENANT cannot be deleted and will return a 403 Forbidden error.
Create a new group with tenantId, name, and optional description. Requires authentication.
Get list of all groups with their tenant relationships. Requires authentication.
Get all groups belonging to a specific tenant. Uses tenantId from environment variable. Requires authentication.
Get a specific group by ID with its tenant relationship. Uses groupId from environment variable. Requires authentication.
Update group name and/or description. Uses groupId from environment variable. Requires authentication.
Delete a group by ID. Uses groupId from environment variable. Requires authentication. Note: System groups (super_admin, admin, user) cannot be deleted and will return a 403 Forbidden error.
Assign a user to a group. Creates a user-group relationship. Requires authentication.
Get all user-group assignments with user and group details. Requires authentication.
Get all groups that a specific user belongs to. Uses userId from environment variable. Requires authentication.
Get all users that belong to a specific group. Uses groupId from environment variable. Requires authentication.
Get a specific user-group assignment by ID. Uses userGroupId from environment variable. Requires authentication.
Remove a user-group assignment by assignment ID. Uses userGroupId from environment variable. Requires authentication.
Remove a user from a group by userId and groupId. Uses environment variables. Requires authentication.

item.name: Get OpenAI Config by Tenant ID
Get WhatsApp Config by Tenant ID

request.description: Get WhatsApp configuration for a specific tenant. Uses tenantId from environment variable. Requires authentication.

Update WhatsApp configuration by config ID. Can update phoneNumberId, apiToken, webhookUrl, webhookVerifyToken, and isEnabled. Uses whatsappConfigId from environment variable. Requires authentication and tenant authorization.
Toggle the enabled/disabled state of WhatsApp configuration. Uses whatsappConfigId from environment variable. Requires authentication and tenant authorization.

Get all variables for a specific tenant. Variables can be of type 'global', 'local', or 'context'. Default context variables include: guest_name, check_in_date, check_out_date, room_number, language. Uses tenantId from environment variable. Requires authentication.
Get a specific variable by ID. Uses variableId from environment variable. Requires authentication.

Create a new variable for a tenant. Choose between 'global' or 'local' as type. Global variables are available across all conversations, local variables are scoped to individual conversations. Required fields: tenantId, name, type. Optional: description, value. Requires authentication.
Create a new local variable for a tenant. Local variables are scoped to individual conversations and not shared globally. Requires authentication.
Update a global variable. Can update name, description, and value. The type field is immutable. Uses variableId from environment variable. Requires authentication and tenant authorization.
Partially update a variable (typically just the value). Useful for quick value updates without changing name or description. Uses variableId from environment variable. Requires authentication.

Delete a variable by ID. Works for both global and local variables. Default context variables (guest_name, check_in_date, check_out_date, room_number, language) may be protected from deletion depending on business logic. Uses variableId from environment variable. Requires authentication and tenant authorization.

item.name: Delete Variable by Tenant and Name

request.description: Delete a variable by tenant ID and variable name. Alternative to deleting by ID. Works for both global and local variables. Requires authentication and tenant authorization.
Get all conversation flows for a specific tenant. Uses tenantId from environment variable. Requires authentication.
Get a specific conversation flow by ID. Uses conversationFlowId from environment variable. Requires authentication.
Create a new conversation flow for a tenant. Required fields: tenantId, name. Optional: description. Automatically saves conversationFlowId to environment. Requires authentication.
Update a conversation flow. Can update name and description. Uses conversationFlowId from environment variable. Requires authentication and tenant authorization.

Clone an existing conversation flow. Creates a copy with the same contextSchema but new name and description. The cloned flow belongs to the same tenant as the original. Automatically saves the new conversationFlowId to environment. Requires authentication.
Delete a conversation flow by ID. Uses conversationFlowId from environment variable. Requires authentication and tenant authorization.
